summary: This module provides an implementation for sending/receiving messages to/from another application process (local or remote) for both connection-oriented and connectionless protocols.
description:
Module Overview

This module provides an implementation for sending/receiving messages to/from another application process (local or remote) for both connection-oriented and connectionless protocols.

TCP Client

The socket:Client is used to connect to a socket server and interact with it. The client can only send the data to the server and the client's call-back service can retrieve the data from the server and do multiple requests/responses between the client and the server.

A Client can be defined by providing the host, port, and callbackService as follows.

socket:Client socketClient = new ({host: "localhost", port: 61598, callbackService: ClientService});
string msg = "Hello Ballerina\n";
byte[] message = msg.toBytes();
var writeResult = socketClient->write(message);

A client's call-back service can be defined as follows:

service ClientService = service {
    resource function onConnect(socket:Caller caller) {
        io:println("connect: ", caller.remotePort);
    }
}

UDP Client

The socket:UdpClient is used to interact with the remote UDP host and it can be defined as follows:

socket:UdpClient socketClient = new;
string msg = "Hello from UDP client";
byte[] message = msg.toBytes();
int|socket:Error sendResult = socketClient->sendTo(message, { host: "localhost", port: 48826 });

Listener

The socket:Listener is used to listen to the incoming socket request. The onConnect(socket:Caller) resource function gets invoked when a new client is connected. The new client is represented using the socket:Caller. The onReadReady(socket:Caller) resource gets invoked once the remote client sends some data.

A socket:Listener can be defined as follows:

listener socket:Listener server = new(61598);
service echoServer on server {

    resource function onConnect(socket:Caller caller) {
        io:println("connect: ", caller.remotePort);
    }

    resource function onReadReady(socket:Caller caller) {
        [byte[], int]|socket:ReadTimedOutError result = caller->read();
    }
}

For information on the operations, which you can perform with this module, see the below Functions. For examples on the usage of the operations, see the following.

  • Basic TCP Socket Example
  • Basic UDP Client Socket Example

fields.name: port
fields.description: The port number of the Socket Address

fields.name: port
fields.description: The port number of the remote service

fields.name: readTimeoutInMillis
fields.description: The socket reading timeout value to be used in milliseconds. If this is not set, the default value of 300000 milliseconds (5 minutes) will be used.

fields.name: callbackService
fields.description: The callback service for the client. Resources in this service gets called on the receipt of the messages from the server.

fields.name: interface
fields.description: The interface for the server to be bound

fields.name: readTimeoutInMillis
fields.description: The socket reading timeout value to be used in milliseconds. If this is not set, the default value of 300000 milliseconds (5 minutes) will be used.

fields.name: readTimeoutInMillis
fields.description: The socket reading timeout value to be used in milliseconds. If this is not set, the default value of 300000 milliseconds (5 minutes) will be used.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The content, which will be sent to the client socket

returnParameters.description: The number of bytes that got written or else a socket:Error if the given data can't be written

remoteMethods.name: write
remoteMethods.description:
Writes the given data to the client socket.

 int|socket:Error writeResult = socketClient:write(payloadByte);

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: Represents the number of bytes, which should be read

returnParameters.description: Content as a byte array and the number of bytes read or else a socket:ReadTimedOutError if the data can't be read from the client

remoteMethods.name: read
remoteMethods.description:
Reads data from the client socket. If the data has the specified length, then it waits until that number of bytes are received from the client. Else, it returns the data available in the OS buffer. In the case of the connection being closed by the client, then return either -1 or the data that is currently available in the buffer. Number of bytes returned will be < 0 if the client closes the connection.

 [byte[], int]|socket:ReadTimedOutError result = socketClient->read();

returnParameters.description: A socket:Error if the client can't close the connection or else ()

remoteMethods.name: close
remoteMethods.description:
Closes the client socket connection.

 socket:Error? closeResult = socketClient->close();

returnParameters.description: A socket:Error if the client can't be shut down to stop reading from the socket or else ()

remoteMethods.name: shutdownRead
remoteMethods.description:
Shuts down any further reading from the socket.

 socket:Error? result = socketClient->shutdownRead();

returnParameters.description: A socket:Error if the client can't shut down to stop the writing to the socket or else ()

remoteMethods.name: shutdownWrite
remoteMethods.description:
Shuts down any further writing from the socket.

 socket:Error? result = socketClient->shutdownWrite();

fields.name: remotePort
fields.description: The remote port number to which this socket is connected

fields.name: localPort
fields.description: The local port number to which this socket is bound

fields.name: remoteAddress
fields.description: The remote IP address string in textual presentation to which the socket is connected

fields.name: localAddress
fields.description: The local IP address string in textual presentation to which the socket is bound

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier to identify each client

parameters.description: This is used to provide the configurations like host, port, and timeout

In the case of the connection being closed by the client, then return either -1 or the data that is currently available in the buffer. initMethod.name: init
initMethod.description: Initializes the TCP socket client with the given client configuration.

clients.name: Client
clients.description: Represents the socket client and related remote functions.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The content to be sent to the client socket

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The address of the remote client socket

returnParameters.description: The number of bytes got written or else a socket:Error if the given data can't be sent

remoteMethods.name: sendTo
remoteMethods.description:
Sends the given data to the specified remote client.

 int|socket:Error result = socketClient->sendTo(c1, {host: "localhost", port: 48826});

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: Represents the number of bytes, which should be read

returnParameters.description: The content as a byte array, the number of bytes read, the address of the sender, or else a socket:Error if the data can't be read from the client

remoteMethods.name: receiveFrom
remoteMethods.description:
Reads data from the remote client. If the data has the specified length, then it waits until that number of bytes are received from the client. Else, it returns the data available in the OS buffer or waits until the data is received. If the request length is lesser than the data in the buffer, then the rest will be discarded.

 [byte[], int, Address]|ReadTimedOutError result = socketClient->receiveFrom();

returnParameters.description: A socket:Error if it can't close the connection or else ()

remoteMethods.name: close
remoteMethods.description:
Closes the client socket connection.

 socket:Error? closeResult = socketClient->close();

Binds a service to the socket:Listener.

 socket:error? result = socketListener.__attach(helloService);

methods.name: __gracefulStop
methods.description:
Stops the socket:Listener gracefully.

 socket:error? result = socketListener.__gracefulStop();

returnParameters.description: () or else a socket:Error upon failure to stop the listener

methods.name: __immediateStop
methods.description:
Stops the socket:Listener forcefully.

returnParameters.description: () or else a socket:Error upon failure to detach the service

methods.name: __detach
methods.description:
Stops consuming messages and detaches the service from the socket:Listener.

 socket:error? result = socketListener.__detach(helloService);

parameters.description: The port number of the remote service

parameters.name: config
parameters.description: Configurations related to the socket:Listener

returnParameters.description: () or else a socket:Error upon failure to stop the listener

listeners.name: Listener
listeners.description: Represents the socket listener on which the socket listener service is registered and started.

errors.name: GenericError
errors.description: Represents generic socket error, which contains the information related to the error.

errors.name: ReadTimedOutError
errors.description: This will returns once the given read timed out time exceed for socket reads.

unionTypes.name: Caller
unionTypes.description: Represents caller object in socket service resources and client callback service resources. This has all the remote functions expose by socket:Client.
